result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:37 PM - cases called - 21CF27, 21CF310, 21CF312, 22CM153 and 22CF194.  Defendant Peter A Potaczek appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer appeared by video for Peter A Potaczek.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding status of these matters.  Court questions Atty Restemayer regarding conflict of interest in 21CF27.  Response by Atty Restemayer.  Court removes 21CF27 from the trial calendar.  Statement by Atty Restemayer regarding bond motions in 21CF310 and 21CF312.  Response by Atty Polzin.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Court converts the cash bonds to signature bonds.  Atty Restemayer waives time limits in 22CF194.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on December 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No contact with the victim or the victim's residence.

1:39 PM - cases called - 22CM153 and 22CF194.  Defendant Peter A Potaczek appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Peter A Potaczek.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  Court notes no victim appeared.  Statement by Atty Restemayer - in receipt of complaint - waive reading - plea of not guilty in 22CM153.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.  Atty Restemayer does not waive time limits for scheduling the preliminary hearing in 22CF194 but requests a specific date and time for a status conference.  Statement by the Court regarding scheduling.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Notice faxed with bond to LISO
